Actually I think I got all that sorted now, and was able to launch using a =
web site that indeed has my contact info in it.

However, I'm now back, fin=
ally, to this error:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: BdbModule not starte=
d

In the Response Code report, the two lines immediately below (preceeding=
) that message are:

	at org.archive.bdb.BdbModule.openDatabase(BdbModule.j=
ava:328)
	at org.archive.bdb.BdbModule.getStoredMap(BdbModule.java:652)

Th=
is is actually the error that led me to try specifying the seed URLs in a f=
ile in the first place. So, I'm sort of back to square one, as they say.

I=
n any case, that's again for the patience and assistance.

--- In archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com, "flemingkr" <kirkrfleming@...> wrote:
>
> Gordon th=
ank you so much for your patience. Commenting out the section you referred =
to allowed me to build error-free, although I'm now facing a warning regard=
ing the user contact URL, which is rejected.
> 
> While I think I understan=
d the purpose of this URL, I don't quite understand how to specify one. I d=
o have 2 or 3 registered domains, but I do not have a site hosted at this t=
ime. But, even if I did, I don't find anything that tells me if there is a =
specified or expected format for the contact information that supposed to b=
e located at the site. Is this documented or just brain-dead obvious to tho=
se with reasonable intelligence :) ?
> 
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogr=
oups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@> wrote:
> >
> > You probably still have the =
example override for 'seeds.textSource.value' in the example 'longerOverrid=
es' bean - this tries to reach into a bean named 'seeds', property 'textSou=
rce', property 'value'. That now doesn't exist in your alternate, file-base=
d seeds configuration. Eliminate the now unnecessary override and the erre =
should go away.
> >
